        <item>
          <title>The Witch and Dirty Grandpa arrive on DVD </title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2016/05/12/the-witch-and-dirty-grandpa-arrive-on-dvd.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">a9c0e22c-e6f9-4089-833c-e8ae1ae09fe6</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:28:55 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/the-witch-and-dirty-grandpa-arrive-on-dvd/thewitch.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>DVD reviews of The Witch and Dirty Grandpa, by Peter Howell
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Peter Howell - Movie Critic</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/the-witch-and-dirty-grandpa-arrive-on-dvd/thewitch.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/the-witch-and-dirty-grandpa-arrive-on-dvd/thewitch.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Anya Taylor-Joy stars as Thomasin in the New England folktale The Witch.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Elevation Pictures</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Bravo renews 19-2 for fourth season</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/television/2016/05/12/bravo-renews-19-2-for-fourth-season.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">173107d8-0cc7-4f42-b2c8-cb1fd5ba7ac1</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:14:18 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/television/2016/05/12/bravo-renews-19-2-for-fourth-season/19-2.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Montreal cop drama debuts Season 3 on June 20.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Debra Yeo - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/television/2016/05/12/bravo-renews-19-2-for-fourth-season/19-2.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/television/2016/05/12/bravo-renews-19-2-for-fourth-season/19-2.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Adrian Holmes, left, and Jared Keeso star as Montreal police officers Nick Barron and Ben Chartier in 19-2.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">B. CALMEAU</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">BELL MEDIA</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Chris Evans and Jenny Slate: the romance we’re rooting for</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/chris-evans-and-jenny-slate-the-romance-were-rooting-for.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">807b4950-eed7-4253-89f3-c77eeebfa24f</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:58:51 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/chris-evans-and-jenny-slate-the-romance-were-rooting-for/jennyslate--staff-photo.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Actor-writer-producer Jenny Slate is dating Chris Evans, aka Captain America.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Star Staff</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/chris-evans-and-jenny-slate-the-romance-were-rooting-for/jennyslate--staff-photo.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/chris-evans-and-jenny-slate-the-romance-were-rooting-for/jennyslate--staff-photo.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Jenny Slate is a former SNL cast member who made her feature starring debut in The Obvious Child. More recently she voiced Bellwether in Zootopia and had a guest-starring role on Girls.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Lucas Oleniuk</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/chris-evans-and-jenny-slate-the-romance-were-rooting-for/evans.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/chris-evans-and-jenny-slate-the-romance-were-rooting-for/evans.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Chris Evans shown last month at the London premiere of Captain America: Civil War.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Ian Gavan</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">GETTY IMAGES</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/chris-evans-and-jenny-slate-the-romance-were-rooting-for/tweet-mindy.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/chris-evans-and-jenny-slate-the-romance-were-rooting-for/tweet-mindy.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Mindy Kaling wins the best reaction to the dating news.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Twitter</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Kelly Ripa has a message: Live! is her show</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/television/2016/05/12/kelly-ripa-has-a-message-live-is-her-show.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">13e9ed8d-9923-4a9a-b98a-5318ce63b6a5</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:50:28 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/television/2016/05/12/kelly-ripa-has-a-message-live-is-her-show/kelly-and-michael.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Michael Strahan’s last day on talk show is Friday.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Emily Yahr - The Washington Post</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/television/2016/05/12/kelly-ripa-has-a-message-live-is-her-show/kelly-and-michael.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/television/2016/05/12/kelly-ripa-has-a-message-live-is-her-show/kelly-and-michael.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Things were a little cosier between Kelly Ripa and Michael Strahan when this photo was taken in 2012. Strahan's last day on Live! is Friday as he departs early to become a Good Morning American co-host.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">CHARLES SYKES</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">INVISION/ASSOCIATED PRESS FILE PHOTO</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Woody Allen responds to Ronan Farrow essay at Cannes</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/woody-allen-responds-to-ronan-farrow-essay-at-cannes.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">5d1bb700-c2de-4176-85cf-8c0429eb3943</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:13:19 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/woody-allen-responds-to-ronan-farrow-essay-at-cannes/woody-and-soon-yi.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Piece by director’s estranged son appeared Wednesday; it took until Thursday for the subject to even be raised at the festival. 
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Steven Zeitchik - Los Angeles Times</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/woody-allen-responds-to-ronan-farrow-essay-at-cannes/woody-and-soon-yi.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/woody-allen-responds-to-ronan-farrow-essay-at-cannes/woody-and-soon-yi.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Director Woody Allen and his wife Soon-Yi Previn arrive on May 11, 2016, for the screening of the film Café Society at the 69th Cannes Film Festival in Cannes, France.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">ALBERTO PIZZOLI</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">AFP/GETTY IMAGES</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>A Bigger Splash showcases Tilda Swinton, Ralph Fiennes at their best: review </title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/a-bigger-splash-showcases-tilda-swinton-ralph-fiennes-at-their-best-review.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">931508b5-d470-4288-b43d-e5dfcbb65020</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:07:15 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/a-bigger-splash-showcases-tilda-swinton-ralph-fiennes-at-their-best-review/splash--dinner.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Ralph Fines and Tilda Swinton are excellent in A Bigger Splash and — surprise! — Dakota Johnson shows she can indeed act,
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Linda Barnard - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/a-bigger-splash-showcases-tilda-swinton-ralph-fiennes-at-their-best-review/splash--dinner.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/a-bigger-splash-showcases-tilda-swinton-ralph-fiennes-at-their-best-review/splash--dinner.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>From left, Tilda Swinton, Dakota Johnson, Matthias Schoenaerts and Ralph Fiennes star in A Bigger Splash.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Jack English</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Fox Searchlight</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Star-struck Julia Roberts attends Cannes Film Festival for the first time </title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/star-struck-julia-roberts-attends-cannes-film-festival-for-the-first-time.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">77e8e5ae-15bf-46e9-a932-54ed1f54f182</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:46:38 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/star-struck-julia-roberts-attends-cannes-film-festival-for-the-first-time/jodie-and-julia.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Is it possible to be one of the world’s biggest movie stars and still be humble and awestruck? Julia Roberts is making it seem that way at the Cannes Film Festival
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Peter Howell - Movie Critic</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/star-struck-julia-roberts-attends-cannes-film-festival-for-the-first-time/jodie-and-julia.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/star-struck-julia-roberts-attends-cannes-film-festival-for-the-first-time/jodie-and-julia.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Jodie Foster, left, directed Julia Roberts in Money Monster. The two are at the Cannes Film Festival to promote the film.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Reuters</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Hands off my butt, Drake hints in Saturday Night Live TV promo</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2016/05/12/hands-off-my-butt-drake-hints-in-saturday-night-live-tv-promo.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">3b5344e3-03dc-4585-b973-8a489a0cc97a</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:08:00 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/hands-off-my-butt-drake-hints-in-saturday-night-live-tv-promo/drake-and-leslie-jonesjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>It appears cast member Leslie Jones can’t keep her hands to herself when the Toronto rapper is within grabbing distance.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Peter Edwards - Star Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/hands-off-my-butt-drake-hints-in-saturday-night-live-tv-promo/drake-and-leslie-jonesjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/hands-off-my-butt-drake-hints-in-saturday-night-live-tv-promo/drake-and-leslie-jonesjpg.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>“Leslie, can you not put your hands on my butt?,” asks Drake.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">TWITTER</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>How Prince Harry got the Queen to diss the Obamas</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2016/05/12/how-prince-harry-got-the-queen-to-diss-the-obamas.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">eadf7c95-0474-421b-94e3-1ffb12e8b3eb</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:02:03 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/how-prince-harry-got-the-queen-to-diss-the-obamas/prince-harry-viral-video.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>The Invictus Games founder tells Hello! Canada that Justin Trudeau is next on his hit list.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Ryan Porter - Entertainment Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/how-prince-harry-got-the-queen-to-diss-the-obamas/prince-harry-viral-video.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/how-prince-harry-got-the-queen-to-diss-the-obamas/prince-harry-viral-video.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Queen Elizabeth II with her grandson Prince Harry as he says "Boom" in a recent video promoting the Invictus Games, which went viral on social media.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">@KENSINGTONROYAL via AP</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/how-prince-harry-got-the-queen-to-diss-the-obamas/hello-prince-harry.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/how-prince-harry-got-the-queen-to-diss-the-obamas/hello-prince-harry.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>An exclusive interview with Prince Harry is in the new issue of Hello!.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Courtesy Hello! Canada</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>A Little too Cozy is a reality show romp — opera-style</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/stage/2016/05/12/a-little-too-cozy-is-a-reality-show-romp-opera-style.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">851ac512-b765-45fe-89cb-49561b0c81b5</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:11:16 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/stage/2016/05/12/a-little-too-cozy-is-a-reality-show-romp-opera-style/a-little-too-cozy.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Against the Grain Theatre’s reworking of Mozart's Cosi fan tutte is set in a TV reality show where two couples win weddings. 
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Trish Crawford - Music</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/stage/2016/05/12/a-little-too-cozy-is-a-reality-show-romp-opera-style/a-little-too-cozy.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/stage/2016/05/12/a-little-too-cozy-is-a-reality-show-romp-opera-style/a-little-too-cozy.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>From left, Shantelle Przybylo, Aaron Sheppard, Cairan Ryan, Clarence Frazer and Rihab Chaieb in A Little Too Cozy.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">TODD KOROL</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">TORONTO STAR</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Anti-‘whitewashing’ campaign puts John Cho into Hollywood movie posters </title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/anti-whitewashing-campaign-puts-john-cho-into-hollywood-movie-posters.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">81f83e82-fd84-478b-93de-b8a403e49d7e</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:07:41 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/anti-whitewashing-campaign-puts-john-cho-into-hollywood-movie-posters/cho3.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Website substitutes the Star Trek actor in posters to protest filmmakers’ use of white actors to play Asians.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Peter Edwards - Star Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/anti-whitewashing-campaign-puts-john-cho-into-hollywood-movie-posters/cho3.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/movies/2016/05/12/anti-whitewashing-campaign-puts-john-cho-into-hollywood-movie-posters/cho3.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>The website #starringjohncho has inserted Cho's image into a number of mainstream movie posters.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">starringjohncho.com</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Orlando Bloom has made me a Belieber: Menon</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2016/05/12/orlando-bloom-has-made-me-a-belieber-menon.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">acd7259c-91f0-4067-a434-558d37194ab7</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:00:00 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/orlando-bloom-has-made-me-a-belieber-menon/bieb-in-a-box.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>In recent weeks, the unthinkable has happened: I feel sorry for Justin Bieber.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Vinay Menon - Columnist</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/orlando-bloom-has-made-me-a-belieber-menon/bieb-in-a-box.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/orlando-bloom-has-made-me-a-belieber-menon/bieb-in-a-box.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Justin Bieber boxes himself in as part of his "Purpose" concert tour, which comes to Toronto next week.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">CHAD BATKA</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">NYT</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Trump presidency ‘not going to happen,’ Clinton-supporting George Clooney thinks</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2016/05/12/trump-presidency-not-going-to-happen-clinton-supporting-george-clooney-thinks.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">f776807e-ac14-4e31-8a33-73cbe981a750</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:28:20 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/trump-presidency-not-going-to-happen-clinton-supporting-george-clooney-thinks/george-clooney-at-cannes.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>But speaking Thursday after the Cannes première of Money Monster — in which the actor plays a loudmouth financial guru who gives bad advice — Clooney complained media have given the U.S. billionaire a free ride on a soapbox.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Peter Howell - Movie Critic</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/trump-presidency-not-going-to-happen-clinton-supporting-george-clooney-thinks/george-clooney-at-cannes.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/12/trump-presidency-not-going-to-happen-clinton-supporting-george-clooney-thinks/george-clooney-at-cannes.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>George Clooney signs autographs Thursday at the 69th Cannes Film Festival in France.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">REGIS DUVIGNAU</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">REUTERS</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Money Monster cashes in on the popular quest for scapegoats: review</title>

But it gets the anger of regular people exactly right.
          
          </description>

            Peter Howell - Movie Critic</author>

	              <media:description>George Clooney stars in Money Monster, directed by Jodie Foster.</media:description>

        <item>

            Victoria Ahearn - The Canadian Press</author>

        <item>
          <title>Heiress Eleanor McCain hits back at estranged husband Jeff Melanson</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2016/05/11/heiress-eleanor-mccain-hits-back-at-estranged-husband-jeff-melanson.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">897e1e58-fc8c-4911-989d-64cea2fdba86</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 17:56:34 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/11/heiress-eleanor-mccain-hits-back-at-estranged-husband-jeff-melanson/melanson-mccain.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Eleanor McCain has hit back at estranged husband Jeff Melanson in new court filings. 
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Nick Patch - Entertainment Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/11/heiress-eleanor-mccain-hits-back-at-estranged-husband-jeff-melanson/melanson-mccain.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/entertainment/2016/05/11/heiress-eleanor-mccain-hits-back-at-estranged-husband-jeff-melanson/melanson-mccain.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Eleanor McCain, the daughter of McCain Foods Limited’s late billionaire co-founder Wallace McCain, asked provincial courts earlier this year to annul her brief marriage to Melanson. She alleged that the former Toronto Symphony Orchestra boss once called Canada’s cultural “turnaround king” had “tricked” her into marriage for money and an escape route from sexual harassment allegations at the Banff Centre.

</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
      </channel>
